reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: CT - Direct Billing. CT - Utilities. Telephone Communications Expenses - All Other Telephone Communications NOC. P-480-OBO-019. D&M - SURCHARGE TRANSP. CT - RSA Token

description.narrative: Covers the costs of repair items including lumber, hardware, masonry, plaster, roofing, window glass, fabricated metal, tiles, paints, decorator supplies, etc.. CT - Utilities [Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.]. CT - Utilities[Covers costs of purchased utilities, i.e., purchase of water, gas, electricity (light and power), sewage, garbage and trash disposal, and metered hot water heating.]. This covers all other telephone communications costs that are not otherwise classified.. P-480-OBO-019 4, RUE EL KHAZIN, Pay Period: 06/01/2018 - 08/31/2018 [Covers the costs of rents or leases of real property with or without option to purchase, including land, structures, and improvements, as well as fixed equipment and furnishings when included in the price. Also includes landlord charges for services such as porterage and separate maintenance costs.]. CT - Direct Billing [Covers costs of automotive parts and accessories when not part of original equipment e.g., tires, tubes, polish, cleaners, minor tools, etc.]. D&M - SURCHARGE TRANSP [Covers the costs of Despatch Agency services purchased through the Working Capital Fund.]. CT - RSA Token [Covers all other telephone communications costs that are not otherwise classified.]

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Bureau of International Narcotics and Law Enforcement Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The United States is strongly committed to supporting democracy in Tunisia, following the 2015 formation of a democratically elected government. In FY 2017, assistance will focus on promoting accountable governance, democratic processes, and civil society, enhancing security capabilities; and expanding economic growth. The FY 2017 request builds upon critical programs initiated after the 2014 and 2015 U.S.-Tunisia Strategic Dialogues. U.S. assistance seeks to: institutionalize democratic processes, good governance, transparency, and inclusive participation; support the ability of the Tunisian police, gendarmerie, and military to provide security for the Tunisian people and contribute to regional security while respecting human rights; and enhance sustainable economic growth on the basis of increased competitiveness, inclusive opportunities, and improved economic governance. Across these efforts U.S. assistance will enhance the constructive engagement of youth and women and seek to mitigate vulnerability to violent extremism and conflict.
